abstract.text: Sets the x-, y-, and z-axis offsets of the transform for the specified time sample.

inlineContent.text: The translation vector to set for the transform relative to its parent coordinate space.
The time sample with which to associate transform information.

Together with the rotation, scale, and shear factors, a translation vector defines the local coordinate space for any object affected by the transform, relative to a parent coordinate space. To work with the complete transform, use the
Setting a new translation synthesizes a complete transform matrix by combining the new translation with the
factors for the specified time. If the new time is outside the range of the
properties, this method updates those values to reflect the range of time samples stored in the transform object.

abstract.text: Import, export, and manipulate 3D models using a common infrastructure that integrates MetalKit, GLKit, and SceneKit.
A description of the local coordinate space transformations for a 3D object.
Returns the orientation of the transform relative to its parent coordinate space, as of the specified time sample.
Returns the orientation of the transform as a rotation matrix, as of the specified time sample.
Returns the x-, y-, and z-axis scale factors of the transform relative to its parent coordinate space, as of the specified time sample.
Sets the orientation of the transform for the specified time sample.
Sets the x-, y-, and z-axis scale factors of the transform for the specified time sample.
Sets the x-, y-, and z-axis shear factors of the transform for the specified time sample.
Sets the x-, y-, and z-axis offsets of the transform for the specified time sample.
Returns the x-, y-, and z-axis shear factors of the transform relative to its parent coordinate space, as of the specified time sample.
Returns the x-, y-, and z-axis offsets of the transform relative to its parent coordinate space, as of the specified time sample.
Returns the local transform matrix as of the specified time sample.
The timestamp for the last timed data sample in the transform component.
The timestamp for the first timed data sample in the transform component.
Sets a new local transform matrix for the specified time sample.
A floating point vector type used to perform physics calculations.
